An RSA-encrypted note was leaked, but a careless admin exposed half the private key. Can you recover the message? Ciphertext: 820916977357473078423215137374340381673050292474210121950348125331735342686749027592830659308880691998246610891314174980489970904888568007040020592531002

The flag format is flag{...}
n=8991718443468862424065120885484748272384895340967920956963406584854838425515638508293226114392940985715773361572302885435377193014788684543399838526851659, e=829148540415513815317788629823466391388646869106764462513434468368578805071492942798652812679154091789648769143316373950991774807873604693107169013815179, partial_p=16798200534500283202

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{qc9afhkl}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 820916977357473078423215137374340381673050292474210121950348125331735342686749027592830659308880691998246610891314174980489970904888568007040020592531002
vulnerability: partial key exposure
hint: A partial exposure of a prime number's bits can significantly weaken RSA security. Look into lattice-based techniques like Coppersmith's attack.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=8991718443468862424065120885484748272384895340967920956963406584854838425515638508293226114392940985715773361572302885435377193014788684543399838526851659, e=829148540415513815317788629823466391388646869106764462513434468368578805071492942798652812679154091789648769143316373950991774807873604693107169013815179, partial_p=16798200534500283202
extra_info: p=105444013726485196063085089185057070942592788571704967586202866249787373430997, q=85274811966023845599328365437565023589790915099318328873674397502134968268447, Ï†(n)=8991718443468862424065120885484748272384895340967920956963406584854838425515447789467533605351278572261150739477770501731706169718328807279647916185152216
